Lasse_Stefanz:
{{Short description|Swedish dansband}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2021}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Lasse Stefanz | image = Lasse Stefanz.jpg | caption = Lasse Stefanz in 2013 | landscape = yes | alt = | background = group_or_band | alias = Lasse Stefans | origin = [[Kristianstad]], Sweden | instrument = | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Dansband]] * [[Country music|country]] }} | occupation = | years_active = 1967–present | label = [[Mariann Grammofon|Mariann]] | associated_acts = {{flatlist| * [[Christina Lindberg (singer)|Christina Lindberg]] * [[Stiftelsen (band)|Stiftelsen]] }} | website = {{URL|lassestefanz.se}} | current_members = {{plainlist| * [[Olle Jönsson]] * Jonas Rignell * Anders Dahlgren * Christer Ericsson * Gunnar Nilsson * Henrik Svensson }} | past_members = * Anders Pettersson * Lasse Sigfridsson * Hans Sigfridsson * Ola Olsson }} '''Lasse Stefanz''' is a Swedish [[dansband]] formed in [[Kristianstad]] in 1967.{{Cite web|url=https://www.discogs.com/artist/794506-Lasse-Stefanz|title=Lasse Stefanz|website=Discogs}} The band was popular during the 1980s. The band was formed by Hans Sigfridsson, Lars Sigfridsson and [[Olle Jönsson]]. Later members are [[Christer Ericsson]], [[Anders Pettersson (musician)|Anders Pettersson]] and [[Gunnar Nilsson]]. [[Olle Jönsson]] is the singer, as well as the ex-drummer. ''Lasse Stefanz'' had hits with [[song]]s as "Oh, Julie" (1982) and released [[album]]s as ''Peppelinos Bar'' (1988). 1989-1990, Lasse Stefanz and [[Christina Lindberg (singer)|Christina Lindberg]] had a [[Svensktoppen]] hit with the song "[[De sista ljuva åren]]". In 1989, Lasse Stefanz was awarded a [[Grammis]] for "Dansband of the year". The band participated in [[Sweden in the Eurovision Song Contest 2011|Melodifestivalen 2011]] with the song "En blick och något händer."{{cite web|url=https://www.eurovision.tv/page/news?id=20423&_t=First+four+entries+for+Sweden+announced|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101014015828/http://www.eurovision.tv/page/news?id=20423&_t=First+four+entries+for+Sweden+announced|url-status=dead|archive-date=14 October 2010|title=First four entries for Sweden announced|last=Siim|first=Jarmo|date=7 October 2010|work=Eurovision.tv|publisher=[[European Broadcasting Union]] (EBU)|accessdate=8 August 2012}} They participated in [[Melodifestivalen 2024]] with "En sång om sommaren",{{cite web|url=https://eurovision.tv/story/30-artists-melodifestivalen-2024|title=The 30 artists competing in Sweden's Melodifestivalen 2024|date=2023-12-01|access-date=2023-12-01|work=Eurovision.tv|publisher=EBU}} being eliminated from their heat on 24 February 2024.{{Cite web |title=Melodifestivalen 2024 - Deltävling 4: Eskilstuna |url=https://mellopedia.svt.se/index.php/Melodifestivalen_2024#Deltävling_4:_Eskilstuna |access-date=2024-02-03 |website=Mellopedia |language=sv |publisher=SVT}} == Personnel == * [[Olle Jönsson]] – vocals * Christer Ericsson – guitars * Jonas Rignell – vocals, guitars, accordion * Gunnar Nilsson – drums * Anders Dahlgren – bass * Henrik Svensson – keyboards, saxophones ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable" !align="center" rowspan="2" width="10"|Year !align="center" rowspan="2" width="170"|Album !align="center" colspan="2" width="20"|Peak positions !align="center" rowspan="2" width="70"|Certification |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:90%;" | [[Sverigetopplistan|SWE]]
